caption:
This photograph captures a scene at what appears to be a border or checkpoint, likely in a warmer climate given the presence of palm trees. The focus of the image is on a large, red mesh bag filled with onions, prominently marked "Treasure Valley, Idaho Oregon U.S. No. 1 Spanish Onions." This bag is being carried by a person wearing a red and blue shirt, only partially visible on the left side of the frame.

The background shows a group of people, mostly men, queued in a line extending towards a gate that is being guarded by officials. These individuals vary in attire but predominantly wear casual, warm-weather clothing. Many are carrying bags or personal belongings, suggesting they might be migrant workers or travelers. To the right, a forklift is visible, indicating that the area might be used for transporting goods as well as movement of people.

The setting is a paved area with a clear sky, with the harsh daylight suggesting midday. The atmosphere portrays a blend of everyday labor-related activity and regulated mobility, typical of a controlled transit area.
title: It's back to mexico for these farm workers who were picked up by the border patrol at calexico for illegal entry.  Higher u.s wages attract 300,000 wetbacks annually, especially to work on rich farm lands watered by the Colorado river
